intro: Phyllanthus balakrishnairii, commonly known as the Balakrishnairii phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It has a woody stem and produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
